concise_definition: v. 恶化, 退化, 变差

definitions.explanation_en: To become progressively worse in quality, condition, or value over time, often due to neglect, age, or external factors.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于疏忽、老化或外部因素，质量、状况或价值随时间逐渐变差。
definitions.example_en: The old bridge has deteriorated significantly due to years of exposure to saltwater.
definitions.example_cn: 这座旧桥因多年暴露在海水中，已严重恶化。

definitions.explanation_en: To decline in health, mental state, or physical function, especially in a gradual and often irreversible way.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指健康、精神状态或身体功能逐渐衰退，通常是不可逆的。
definitions.example_en: After the accident, his cognitive abilities began to deteriorate rapidly.
definitions.example_cn: 事故发生后，他的认知能力开始迅速衰退。

definitions.explanation_en: To worsen in terms of relationships, atmosphere, or social conditions, often leading to conflict or instability.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指关系、氛围或社会状况变差，常导致冲突或不稳定。
definitions.example_en: Tensions between the two countries have deteriorated since the trade dispute began.
definitions.example_cn: 自贸易争端开始以来，两国之间的紧张关系不断恶化。

comparison.analysis: “Degrade” (退化/贬低) 通常带有更强的贬义，强调被降低到更低的等级、尊严或价值，常用于道德、社会地位或环境层面的贬损。而 “deteriorate” 更中性，侧重于自然或客观的衰退过程，不一定涉及人为贬低。
“Decline” (衰退/下降) 可指数量、水平或强度的减少，常用于经济、人口或健康等可量化的领域，语气较温和。而 “deteriorate” 更强调质量或状态的全面变差，常带有负面情感色彩，且多用于不可逆的恶化。
“Worsen” (变糟) 是 “deteriorate” 最直接的同义词，但更口语化、更通用，适用于任何情境下的变差。而 “deteriorate” 更正式，常用于书面语或专业语境，尤其强调缓慢、渐进的恶化过程。
